title: Project Title
text:
Code
# These are the packages used in the report
library(tidyverse)
This slide deck presents the main insights:
Presentation in standalone browser tab.
Detailed project report
The following headlines are suggestions only.

title: Project Title
text:
1 Outline
What questions will the report address and why?
How can data be accessed. Code for loading.
Information how data is collected. Who collects data.
Be very brief here, if necessary provide and refer to an appendix. You can also use footnotes.1
Your report shall follow an “inverted pyramid” story format (see Dykes 2019) .
Remove all this text and put you content.2






Note



If the final report has sufficient quality, it can be published to the web directly from here. If you plan that, check for licences of usage for figures you use and potential data privacy violations when you have data in the repository before.

title: Project Title
text:
2 Main Insight
Better give a more substantial title!
This should present you main point visually with one (or more) figures.


Code
mpg |> ggplot(aes(displ, hwy)) + geom_point()








Figure 1: The figure shows this … (but is just a placeholder).





Figure 1 shows the insight.
Refer here to

Additional visualizations and analysis below
Interactive Visualization / Dashboard below

title: Project Title
text:
3 Additional insights
Better give a more substantial title.

3.1 You may have subsections here or elsewhere


3.2 However, subsections usually make sense when there is more than one

title: Project Title
text:
4 Conclusion
Topics like: What have we learned? How does it fit in or help in broader contexts? Any actions recommended? What remains open? What are next steps? Which of these questions are most relevant depends on the type of your project.

title: Project Title
text:
5 Interactive Visualization / Data Dashboard

Either have this here or on another webpage (new quarto file).
Interactive visualizations may also appear above.
The focus here is to provide the reader with sensible ways to explore the data independently. You have to think about what could be of interest.

title: Project Title
text:
6 Data Source

If specific information and details about the data source would be too long in the “Outline” section, put it in an appendix section.

title: Project Title
text:
7 Other appendix sections

Do the same with other text which distracts the reading of the main text.

title: Project Title
text:
References



Dykes, Brent. 2019. Effective Data Storytelling: How to Drive Change with Data, Narrative and Visuals. John Wiley & Sons. https://books.google.com?id=rHDDDwAAQBAJ.

title: Project Title
text:
Footnotes


This is a footnote, which can be used for more information which maybe a reader.↩︎
Using this template is not mandatory.↩︎
